revision.text:
'''Roaming Pokémon''' are rare Pokémon that can be found randomly while on routes. Each [[Region|region]] has a set of Roaming Pokémon that can be caught. So far, only Mew and Manaphy have no requirements to appear.
==Odds==
''For a breakdown of roaming chances on every route, visit the [[Route Statistics]] page.''
The chance to encounter a roaming Pokémon is 1/8192 for the first route of a region, and increases linearly up to 1/4096 for the last route of a region. "First" and "last" here refer to the health of the Pokémon on these routes, not necessarily the order they are unlocked. This means that a route you can 1-shot will always be at least as efficient as a route you can't, so it is recommended to idle on the highest route number you can 1-shot if you need them.
==Regions== {| class="wikitable collapsible" |- ! Region !! Roaming Pokemon !! Unlock Condition |- | [[Kanto]] || [[File:Mew.png|40px]] Mew || No current requirement |- | rowspan=3|[[Johto]] || [[File:Entei.png|40px]] Entei || rowspan=3|Clear [[Dungeons#Johto|Burning Tower]] |- |[[File:Raikou.png|40px]] Raikou |- | [[File:Suicune.png|40px]] Suicune |- | rowspan=3|[[Hoenn]] || [[File:Latios.png|40px]] Latios || rowspan=3|Become the [[Towns_%26_Cities#Hoenn_Cities_.26_Towns|Hoenn Champion]] |- | [[File:Latias.png|40px]] Latias |- | [[File:Jirachi.png|40px]] Jirachi |- | rowspan=3|[[Sinnoh]] || [[File:Manaphy.png|40px]] Manaphy || No current requirement |- | [[File:Cresselia.png|40px]] Cresselia || Clear [[Dungeons#Sinnoh|Fullmoon Island]] |- | [[File:Mesprit.png|40px]] Mesprit || Clear [[Dungeons#Sinnoh|Lake Verity]] |}
[[Category:Unique Pokémon]]

'''Roaming Pokémon''' are rare Pokémon that can be found randomly while on routes. Each [[Region|region]] has a set of Roaming Pokémon that can be caught. So far, only Mew and Manaphy have no requirements to appear. ==Odds== ''For a breakdown of roaming chances on every route, visit the [[Route Statistics]] page.'' The chance to encounter a roaming Pokémon is 1/8192 for the first route of a region, and increases linearly up to 1/4096 for the last route of a region. "First" and "last" here refer to the health of the Pokémon on these routes, not necessarily the order they are unlocked. This means that a route you can 1-shot will always be at least as efficient as a route you can't, so it is recommended to idle on the highest route number you can 1-shot if you need them. ==Regions== {| class="wikitable collapsible" |- !
